headline: US cattle producers have started rebuilding herds, or will soon, Tyson Foods CEO says
summary: U.S. cattle producers have started rebuilding the nation's herd or are close to doing so, Tyson Foods CEO Donnie King said on Wednesday, after supplies dwindled to a 74-year low.  Tight cattle inventories have driven up beef prices for U.S. consumers and forced meatpackers, including Tyson and rivals like Cargill and JBS, to pay more for livestock to slaughter.  "Everybody is hesitant, including me, to call that we are now in rebuild," King said on a webcast of BMO's Farm to Market Conference.
